website_summaries.verdict: The best drip irrigation system kit capable of use with hanging gardens or plants in separate containers.
pros: Long tubing lengths make it easy to run water lines between several containers at once
Included clips offer a strong, secure connection for hanging plants in bad weather
cons: The extra pieces in the kit take a long time to set up properly

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and worked great for about 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and worked great for about 6 months but then it started leaking. And, in spite of my attempts at communicating with the company, they are not even responding to my request for warranty refund/replacement. So, I'd say, look at another company. I mean, it's one thing to have a defective product, that happens with every company. But it's another thing to blow off a customer who is pointing out an issue with your product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great, while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a little more than six months. Now it has a constant drip, no matter what I set the timer to. I contacted the seller and will update my review if they respond. Update: I emailed the manufacturer and they responded promptly. After sending photos for proof, they said they would send a replacement. However, it's been over two months and it hasn't arrived. They have also stopped answering my emails.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I installed the kit following the instructions, but once I finished the installation, I realized that the timer was defective - the water flow would never stop. I called Raindrip's customers support and after some troubleshooting they confirmed that the timer is defective. The technician mentioned that they are having a lot of quality issues with products sold on Amazon and he suggested to buy a new unit at Lowe's or Home Depot, which I found funny. Why should the quality on Amazon be different than Lowes or Home Depot? Why don't the simply do a better quality control? I will have to unmount the hose and return it. A lot of wasted time.
customer_reviews.author: Pure Zen Joy

customer_reviews.title: Set and forget, plants love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit! It took me about an hour or two to completely install all my tubing into my porch, but the results speak for themselves. I run it at about 5-15 minutes, 2x a day, at 8am and 8PM during the summer. My plants LOVE it. I also use a Miracle-Grow LiquaFeed universal system inline with the drip system and manually run that once every two weeks for about 5 minutes to kick my plants into hyper growth. This will be the second summer I use the kit on and I am still using the same batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Chodroff

customer_reviews.title: Loose fittings.....leak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as a Christmas gift for her hanging planters. Every T fittng leaks. I dont know if the tubing is too big or the T is too small. Also the plastic nail clamps break easy. Very very disappointed in this product being a cost $40. I wasted $40 and have an unhappy wife.
customer_reviews.author: DALE

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as intended
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice concept, but as an amateur Gardner with a few years of experience, this product just doesn’t work as intended. For starters, the hose comes wound up, so it will not lay straight. Common problem and understandable, but still problematic. Second, the spikes they give you to hold the wound up hose down, are not long enough or strong enough to hold the hose in place. I tried for a few days to set it up and just could not get the sprinklers where they needed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: And another one bites the dust.
customer_reviews.text: First controller showed up dead on arrival. Returned it. Second controller worked fine in the beginning, but then after about 2-3 months, the automatic mode seemed to be erratic. I wasn't positive that it wasn't just me -- maybe I didn't hear it turn on? Maybe it was just so hot that day that the water evaporated? So I started watching it, kind of freakishly. No, the automatic setting no longer worked. But "manual" did, and turning it on to drip in the mornings was tolerable. Now the manual setting no longer works. Basically what you're buying here is some cheap tubing and a controller that may or may not work for several weeks, and then die.
customer_reviews.author: Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, although hold-down spikes too small, and water-pressure regulator needed
customer_reviews.text: The metal spikes used to attach the watering hose to the soil are too small, and often pop back up. I bought longer, heavier plastic spikes (from Amazon), which work quite well. Also, make sure to buy a water-pressure regulator. This Raindrip system works well only when the water pressure is not too high - it needs to be around 20 psi. Otherwise, the high pressure prevents the water droplets from emitting through the tiny hose holes. I bought a regulator (from Amazon), which also works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jones-D'Agostino

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: 1) Get the PSI regulator as all other reviews suggest. (Its cheap) 2) Get/use a Staple gun for securing with U-shaped staples. (Especially for hanging baskets) 3) Wrap the control box in a zip-lock and clamp/tape off to prevent water from ruining it. (Especially if your faucet drips/sprays) 4) Pick up extra tubing because it’s always great to have extra if you decide to add more plants or rearrange the system (It’s still pretty cheap.) 5) Enjoy this the peace and easy this small little wonder provides for you. Talk about life changing. Also, you can always upgrade the control to something more sophisticated if you ready get nuts with your tubing and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Reliable watering you can count on!
customer_reviews.text: We work and travel a good bit often times leaving out beloved pepper plants and potted plants behind. I was paying a neighbor teen $5 per day to water. That gets expensive and I started to look for options. This kit was super easy to setup and test. Works wonderfully and I just returned from a 10 day trip not knowinh what to expect when I returned. San Antonio, TX summer heat are awful but the plants are healthy, lush green and I'm thrilled with this product. Amazing and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Buy
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the instructions. It was mostly graphic and expected you to figure it out like but didn’t show what parts were used the graphics. For the timer, it does help to look up the video on YouTube. So it was like a puzzle. That part was what took the longest. The hooks they include in the kit does not go into brick or concrete so I used Command Strips (Christmas light version) to hold the tubing. It took me about an hour to get the tubing cut and pieced together. But after everything was up and running, it’s so fantastic! No excessive water used and Consistent watering! I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kim

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: I will say that the timer with my original shipment was defective--but I believe that is probably unusual by looking at the reviews. In any case, I filled out a return, requested a replacement and received the replacement shipment the second day--obviously processed before I got the return to the UPS store. I appreciated the prompt attention and the replacement worked as expected. Installation took me more than 20 minutes but it was very straightforward and simple. I would suggest ordering a pressure regulator and a Y connector if you need them because they are not included. I love the freedom of not having to babysit my plants.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Convenient drip irrigation
customer_reviews.text: Works well. For it to work properly you will need the following in addition to the Raindrip kit - 1) 25 psi regulator if you have good tap water pressure. Even using a 50 ft hose won't drop the pressure by much and the kit won't work at high pressures. 2) petroleum jelly . I use a little bit to coat the hose threads , regulator threads, and timer threads to stop leaks. I DO NOT use it on the tubing. Be prepared for sore fingers. And don't forget to use fresh batteries in the timer, turn on the faucet and use the manual setting for testing. I will update this review over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love and hate relationship
customer_reviews.text: If this is a kit I don’t understand why they don’t include the 25psi regulator which I had to buy separately. Oh and this leaks like crazy!!!! I mean it’s nice that I don’t have to constantly water but at the same time it’s wasting so much water. I had to put a bucket to catch the leaking water so I can reuse it. I’m going to have to try couple other things to see if I can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Laniakea's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Wont last; breaks
customer_reviews.text: Dead 1 yr later. Bad solenoid or something; it wont seal under pressure. Worked for 4 months but Did not use all winter; dead. Edit: I own 2 of these systems and only the 2nd one broke so I called the CS # for Raindrip (Not easy to find that number by the way) and got connected to tech support. They were extremely friendly and ran through some questions/tests of the system and then he said my evaluation was correct and that he would be happy to send me out a new timer. I am happy with this and Changing my review from 1 star to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Crown Jul

customer_reviews.title: A gentle turn
customer_reviews.text: This kit is awesome, waters all the plants, if you just turn the hose on a 1/4 you know like less than half then you don't need to buy the pressure regulator with this, I have the hose connection on a trickle and it works slick, plants always have damp soil
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: It did not work, the faucet hose timer leaked water did no function in all areas. It was really a big disappointment to have set it all up then to find the timer leaked water. It does not tell you need a water pressure reducer on residential water system. I would NOT recommend this at all. I went to my local irrigation Co and bought everything from them and the hose faucet timer. I couldn’t be happier. I should have done this in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Pure Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Far easier to install than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I held off on purchasing this type of thing for several years because I was afraid it would be difficult to install. I was wrong. It was EASY. It also works very well. Does exactly what I expected. FWIW, I have it set to run once every 24 hrs for 3 minutes. That seems to be enough for my hanging baskets. Maybe if it get hotter I'll crank it up a bit. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sareinhart

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this product. Bought to keep a raise vegetable garden watered while we were away for a week. No rain while we were gone and plants looked great when we got back. It claims that it senses rain and will not water if rain detected. I have seen it rain and this thing watering at the same time, so don't count on that feature. However, don't really have a problem with that.
customer_reviews.author: Face

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I had priced these at the big box stores and thought they were expensive. When I saw the price on this one, I was somewhat doubtful of the quality. When it arrived I was pleasantly surprised. It was easy to install and has saved me so much time and makes it so easy to travel and not worry about my plants surviving me being gone. I water twice per day for 15 minutes each time. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Ray

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, works well, buying more!
customer_reviews.text: I put this together quickly right before I had to go out of town for a family emergency. It arrived as expected & it was a snap to put together. I took off & my fingers were crossed that I would not arrive back to my home in FL to dead plants! Thank goodness it worked perfectly & I had a jungle of flowers to meet me. It does a better job than I do watering. Best purchase I’ve made this growing season! & by the way it came with everything, all I needed was a clipper to cut the line.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Product could be great but SO many of the drippers are defective
customer_reviews.text: This system is reasonably priced and could be fantastic but I've had problems with too many of the drippers. In my first order, at least 6 of the included 20 drippers didn't drip. Rather, they sprayed water at full force and would've drowned my plants had I let the system continue to run. In my replacement order, I've had the same issue with about 30% of the drippers I've tried so far. This system could be great but I'd recommend buying additional drippers (from another company) to replace the ones included that will, in all likelihood, be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little sprinkler system not great but good. The timer works as it should and waters my flower bed on time. Some of the nozzle don't have a lot of pressure as others but it's ok for the price I am pleased as long as I can get some water on my plants when I'm working long hours and no time to water the plants in this 100 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: UNK

customer_reviews.title: Pressure regulator should be included like other kits!
customer_reviews.text: Pressure regulator should be included like other kits! Raindrip included this in other kits. Mine wouldn’t work at all without it. Get the Senninger Pressure Regulator 25 PSI 3/4" Hose Thread Drip Irrigation Pressure Reducer Low Flow Valve - Landscape Grade High Performance here on Amazon:
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this raindrop system after researching a ton of different kinds and this one had the best reviews over all. From the very first time we used it our timer did not work. So we asked our neighbors to manually turn it on for us while we were out of town. There was apparently only a 30 day window to return it which is frustrating because now we’re stuck with a product that doesn’t work. After reading more reviews it seems like the timer is the problem across-the-board. Would not recommend to my friends. Sadly it is a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has been working well except the instructions are very poor. I had no idea that you had to cut the hose and make your own feed lines. That was not made clear in the instructions I had to go to YouTube. But the product works great and allows me to go away for the weekend and not worry about my flowers not being watered. The timer is very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and very reliable system
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver for my plants on the porch this year. I’m kinda sad I had to bring it in for winter. It hooked up in 30 minutes did the entire long porch and set the timer and it took over for the entire growing season ... I stalled about a month after buying it because I thought it would take much longer... jump right in there it’s easy... and you can change your mind and rearrange as well..👍🏼 Great system
customer_reviews.author: K. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our potted plants so we could go on vacation and not have to worry about them while we were away. Installed it about 5 days before we went away. Checked it to see if it was working and it was. All 5 heads stopped working while we were away for a week and it was super hot out. Needless to say all 5 plants died. I changed out each head and it works like new again... but first how long??? Would not recommend this product if you can’t be home to check on it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Saves time!!
customer_reviews.text: I hated having to take down my 5 hanging flower baskets to water them and using a wand was also a pain as the water would often drip down my arm. After installing this system, I no longer had to manually water my baskets! I set the timer to water them slowly four times a day and my plants thrived! Being hanging baskets, the hot weather dried them up so fast. This way, they stayed moist and I saved myself money purchasing new plants when one would die! Love this system!!
customer_reviews.author: Pkline

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is a good system. Our water pressure is on gravity flow and this works fine, but we noticed that there seems to be more drip at the beginning of the strip than at the end of a 20 foot run. We’re using it for small plants along the house with 2 hanging baskets and in ground plants (approximately 12).
customer_reviews.author: sjones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Buying another one for the front of my house.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! This is easy to install (I cut the tubing with scissors), simple to operate and came with an abundance of hardware (75 feet of tubing, along with plenty of spikes, tees, clamps, etc.). I have mine watering nine potted plants around my back deck. Now I'm going to order one for the plants in the front of my house. The fittings are press-in and are a good fit - they are not easy to pull apart once they are connected, which is what you want.The only tools I used for the complete installation were a hammer and a pair of scissors.
customer_reviews.author: M.Reed

customer_reviews.title: Top quality!
customer_reviews.text: A quality product. The timer is well made and easy to use. Everything went together nicely, no problem. Now just need to find optimum setting. Can easily over do it. 1/2 gpm for 5 minutes equals 2.5 gallons, which is more than my plants need. I normally water 2 gallons every other day, so these are very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: FredL.

customer_reviews.title: And the drips heads are TERRIBLE. Some don't work at all
customer_reviews.text: This was simple to set up. Not sure why some of the reviews were saying it's hard to get the tubing on the connections. I didn't have any problems. They are a little tight, but they need to be snug. BUT, it leaks at about half of the connections. And the drips heads are TERRIBLE. Some don't work at all. Some drip very, very little. Some are just right. On some of them I have replaced the head and it works "ok". Which tells me these are subpar heads. If anything, in my opinion, the nipples are NOT LONG ENOUGH and the barbs are not thick enough.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Parker

customer_reviews.title: This product worked great for a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for a few weeks. it allowed me to go on vacation without hiring anyone to water my garden. unfortunately it randomly stopped working and my garden died. Really its my fault. I should have checked it more, but it worked great so i honestly put my faith into it. I dont know why it doesn't work anymore. The drippers were too slow for some plants but it wasn't hard to go to a local hardware store and get a different brand that still worked well with it. I will add a picture so you can see how many plants it covered.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Artiles

customer_reviews.title: Read the review
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and set up, but the device makes a very loud squeal noise when the water flow through it for the entire time you have it on. Very, very annoying. The drips are not uniform, so farther down the line the less water comes out. If I had to do it all over again, I would find a different device.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have some inconsistencies in flow from plant to plant. Overall very pleased. Install was easy although not a 25 minute job as the carton claims. Working overhead cutting and running all the lines was a bit time consuming but not difficult at all. Instructions are good and the YouTube video first definitely helped.
customer_reviews.author: Kulaponeke

customer_reviews.title: Damaged item
customer_reviews.text: ...if it arrives in a working condition...I might be happy. This one however came predamaged. See photo - 90% of the water leaves the device through that hole. Yes I use a pressure regulator that I had to buy in a second shipment... absolutely pointless to not include one in a kit that claiming to have everything included you need!
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use but the gadget that connects the tubbing to the hose bib leaks. I'd rather all the leaks, drip on my plants. EDIT: I asked the manufacture about the issue and got a response the next day (it was Sunday). I followed their instructions and had it fixed in minutes. RATING IS NOW A 5
customer_reviews.author: Tom Neal

customer_reviews.title: Worked really great for about a month.
customer_reviews.text: It was exctly 30 days from the time this was ordered to the day it stopped working. I tried everything to get it going again. Battery tester recorded batteries were down to about 0.6V each, or 1.2 volts together. So new batteries were used. New batteries show 1.8V each or 3.6 volts together in the housing. No good. The control unit stopped flashing the led light all together. No lights at all. That is when I chose to return it on Amazon dime because I am prime. Prime is cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mark42Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is super! The twenty minute assembly time is a joke, but I doubt anyone would think that was true. I set mine up on my back porch and ran it through the bottom of the privacy fence. I planted 8 large pots and put in two droppers per pot. It takes a little to find the right setting. Just remember that it's not going to soak the top of the pot. The dropper will make a tiny hole in the top soli and then the water will spread out below. My plants are happy and healthy. You just need to check them for pests. The watering takes care of itself.
customer_reviews.author: Imslick

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily, and works as expected. I had no problems. The little plastic stakes could be longer and stronger. In soft dirt the don't hold well and in hard dirt they bend easily. Overall I like the system, saves the watering chore on my bucket garden. Good value just add the pressure regulator.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality-
customer_reviews.text: Tube comes apart from stem when running! While it was easy to set up, it doesn’t work on the timer. Manual set up works. I thought I’d live with manual even thought really wanted a timer, but now that for the second time the tube came off the stem I might ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Roninkan

customer_reviews.title: This was surprisingly easy to set up and get started
customer_reviews.text: This was surprisingly easy to set up and get started. Solved a problem I had for watering my container plants while traveling. When I realized some pots would need more water than others, it was easy to go back and add another drip line to one pot without disrupting the others. I was so pleased, I bought one for my daughter and grandchildren to start a garden at their home. The kids loved being part of the process. The only downside I've experienced is that the spigots are not always conveniently placed in relation to the pots which means the thin tube running from the spigot to the first pot may cross through a walkway.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Hassle free watering system
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I set it up on my porch going to seven flower boxes where I had previously tried to grow plants unsuccessfully. All of my plants are growing quickly and continued to do so when I left for vacation for 11 days. Setup was easy, I did the entire think in an afternoon using only the materials provided, a small hammer and knife. I have had no issues up to this point. I have continued to looks at automatic watering systems and have not found anything that is a better value.
customer_reviews.author: joseph hunt

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.  Battery life is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Functionally the product works fine. The issue is the batteries do not last more than 3 weeks. The cost of the batteries over the life of the product is outrageous at this rate. The other problem is by the time you recognize the battery life issue it is too late to return the product!
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to install. Currently I use it to add water to a bird bath and it works like a charm. I have ordered a second set to install for another bird bath and am looking forward to installing it. At some time in the future I will use one of them to water some bushes in my front lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you are handy with your hands
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap and it works. Note: This does not need a pressure reduction fitting like the other products. It was hard to install. Hint 1. Use very hot water to make the tube loosen up so you can insert the dripper or joint. Hint 2: There was no end piece to plug up the end of the tube if you don't wants a dripper there - screw in a very small wood screw.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper 1747

customer_reviews.title: Instructions incomplete, beware if you have good water pressure!
customer_reviews.text: This kit killed several of my hanging baskets. They mention a minimum water pressure required, however, it WILL NOT WORK if your water pressure is high. There is no mention of this in the instructions and you MUST use a pressure regulator if your water pressure is on the high side. Very disappointed in this product because it is extremely hard to diagnose and killed 120$ worth of plants. Otherwise, it installs easily and the timer works, if is a bit unintuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Booth

customer_reviews.title: Control Timer Leaks...BADLY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and we hooked it up and found that not much water would come out of the ends of the tubes. Couldn't really figure out the issue, although now looking at the latest comments/reviews on here that it is likely due to a pressure regulator needing to be installed with this system. Now we went to hook it up this year (stored inside for the winter) and the Control Timer LEAKS HORRIBLY out of every possible place. Needless to say, I do NOT endorse this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to spending a worry free summer vacation by using the Raindrip R560DP Automatic Watering Kit by "raindrip" on my 12 potted plants at home. The system was easy to install but when I tested the water system flow by putting one of the dripper heads into a 5 gallon bucket, there was only a half inch of water in the bucket after 2 hours...agonizing slow. I have plenty of water pressure, so that wasn't a problem. Leave the timer on for 6 hours every day you say? Timer only goes up to 120 minutes per 24 hrs. Not nearly enough water for hot summer days. So, I hired someone to water my plants:)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Froelke

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: At first you think it's a good product the holes are good on it but the timer itself leaks it does make sense I tried on two different pipes two different washers plus the ones that it came with and nothing waste of money and time my honest review
customer_reviews.author: latika

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad!
customer_reviews.text: Not a happy experience. The drippers are a load of rubbish. Out of the 20 only 7 dripped consistently and these all had different flow rates - well below 0.5 gph. (Except one which squirted a jet 12 inches long). To make a working system I purchased some adjustable rate Rain Bird drippers which work fine. The only saving grace is that the Raindrip R560DP Automatic Watering Kit cost was less than the Amazon individual price of the timer and tubing! So far (less than 24 hours) the hybrid system is working well, the timer is working correctly and the tubing isn't leaking!
customer_reviews.author: Ex-pat Brit

customer_reviews.title: TI like the setup it does take some trail and error To get right
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my potted plants in Vegas this has actually helped me keep my broccoli and tomatoes alive even though out 111 degree summers. I would forget to water some days and ruin my small garden. Setup takes some trial an error. I ended up changing some of the drip heads so I could adjust the water myself some of my containers are large and were not getting enough water.
customer_reviews.author: anthony jiles

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. I would give negative stars.
customer_reviews.text: The shipping box came open! Some parts of the pipe was damaged heavily and water seems to be leaking. Unfortunately I noticed this only after installing it completely. Otherwise I would have returned it! Overall poorly made product and will never recommend this to anyone considering to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Avey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price, may need more tubing
customer_reviews.text: While it took longer than 20 mins, the system is easy to install and the tubing easy to hide. Left tubing in the sun for a bit as recommended and pushing on the tees and emitters was not hard. I did use every inch of tubing and only used 10 of the emitters. My house and porch is 27' wide and I could have used a few more feet of tubing.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN KNOWLES

customer_reviews.title: It’s keeping my plants alive.
customer_reviews.text: This system has been a lifesaver! I started my first container garden this year and with my 12 hour work days I would often come home to sad droopy leaves. These little drippers are set to water 2x a day for 3 mins. and my plants are thriving!! I love the manual switch on it too. If the heat spikes I can go out and get it a quick 3 minute manual watering and then set it back to its regular schedule with no fuss. I did have to buy a splitter so that everything fit right, and I find that the fitting between the timer attachment and the splitter always drips a little. Still though. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha C.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product offered at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: Installing the Raindrip R560DP Automatic Container and Hanging Baskets Kit to water eleven potted plants and concealing the supply tubing took less than two hours. The only tool needed was a construction knife. This components of this kit are sturdier and better made than those of a well-known competitive product I've used in the past. The included timer is a no-brainier to set up and the kit comes with enough connectors and drip fittings to leave a good supply to cover future damage and blockages. Unless your plants are close to your water source, you'll need to purchase an extra coil of tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well, but be careful with long stretches of ...
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well, but be careful with long stretches of water lines. The pressure of the spouts near the start is much higher than the ones towards the end of the water line, and as a result plants closer to the start get much more water. If you're careful with lengths and where you place spouts so that they all get roughly the same pressure, you'll get even watering.
customer_reviews.author: Max Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Love this system
customer_reviews.text: This system is great. Easy to assemble. The tubing in this kit is a hard vinyl tubing which I used as my main supply line. I heated the vinyl tubing with a lighter to soften it up and create a bond on the connector. Also, I bought extra rubber tubing to branch off the main line with and it worked well and was easier to hook up to all the individual connections. Note that your water spigot must be up off the ground a fair amount (around a foot) to easily accommodate the timer and the hose connection. Been using this about a month now and it is still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Oh Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: This is totally wonderful. Easy to set up, less than an hour. Easy to program and run. I travel a lot. This device has saved my plants. You can give your plants just the amount of water you desire. I was just going to use this with my deck plants only when I go away....temporary installation. I now have it permanently done. I changed the routing twice....so easy to do. Been on three trips .... worry free. For the price, this is a miracle. I enjoy watering my many plants each day......but for those days when I'm on the fly, off to work running late.....I can just turn on the timer. O yeah.
customer_reviews.author: Sunking

customer_reviews.title: Hose line so small you get no pressure after about the 3 potted plant.
customer_reviews.text: The feeder hose is so small that by the time you get to your 3 or 4th potted plant, the pressure drops to zero and there is literally no water coming out. I have very strong pressure coming from my hose spicket, so that is not the issue. I also did not use a pressure regulator...still, zero pressure after the third potted plant. In addition, the round "drip" attachments let out such a small amount of water, you'd need to let it run all night to properly water a large potted plant.
customer_reviews.author: Florida chick

customer_reviews.title: Killed My Plants
customer_reviews.text: Set this system up to water ten potted plants while I was away on vacation. Did a trial run and everything seemed fine, but when I came home I found several of my plants dead, and the rest barely alive. I inspected the watering line and for some reason the droppers were only squeezing out small drops of water rather than the constant stream I had seen during my test run. Overall, I regret buying this system and wouldn't recommend it to fellow growers.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Vayner

customer_reviews.title: I freakin love it
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to install, tubes are cut easily as well, it’s kept my wife’s plants Aline because her green thumb isn’t so green. Saving myself a ton of money installing this. Now I don’t have to get new plants every 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Theadore-Rex

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: So it is a really great value for the timer alone. BUT I ended up using this for a veggie garden and I was not happy with the drippers. I ended up buying a different brand with sprinkler nozzles which were compatible and I am much happier overall.
customer_reviews.author: katie may

customer_reviews.title: Great system for containers on a deck
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Works well. One issue - a few emitters clogged and need to be replaced. Emitters cannot be adjusted. You can buy emitters online which do allow you to adjust the flow rate of water but not from Raindrip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Raindrip- so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The area near faucet is leaking. I spent 1 hr setting this up and the first 6 inches leak. Ugh!!! It is in the sealed section where it converts from standard hose diameter to provided tubing. My previous kit worked great.
customer_reviews.author: lfrogger

customer_reviews.title: not durable and confusing
customer_reviews.text: The controller is super confusing. I still don’t know when and for how long my plants are being watered! The connectors are very cheap and snap with a gentle tug - this isn’t after years of use, less than a month and 2 elbow connectors snap in half.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaD

customer_reviews.title: Works great, missing a few pieces.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and install. The auto controls are a little confusing since it doesnt turn on and run when you first set it its hard to know if its working correctly. There is an indicator light to you know if its set to auto or manual and if the batteries are working from a distance, which is great. The tubing ia a bit stiff so it can be difficult to work with around curves etc. The reason I only gave it three stars is because my kit was missing a few connector pieces. Also, it doesn't come with nearly enough elbows.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Buckowing

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use this product to water my potted plant on time mode. It's a piece of crap! The outflow tube from the timer box was spewing water when I set on manual mode! Therefore pressure was lost so drip points were dry. There is no present time setting so auto timing is difficult. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: takoeye

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and the company. The timer is very easy to use. Setup took a little longer than 30 min but it works great. You may need a regulator (if the nozzles pop out, the pressure is too strong, get a regulator from them for $12)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: which as easy to do as described
customer_reviews.text: I installed the drip system, which as easy to do as described. Unfortunately, when I went to test it, I discovered the timer is a dud! It does not turn on or work at all. I used several sets of batteries and tested the manual mode. The timer failed to turn off the water each time. I did not see any lights (not sure if I should) or hear it click on in any way. There was no indication to let me know that it is turning on at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Grrrrrrrr...took a little time to get right
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, this drip irrigator works as described. But installation is no 20-minute process...no way. And just to clarify, this basic system comes with about 120-feet of 1/4-inch supply line which you cut to fit both the supply feed and legs for individual drippers for pot/plants as you need. You definitely need a spool silicon tape or the timer box input will leak for sure. Worked well for my container veggie garden.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.B.

customer_reviews.title: Could use more specific information about the timer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful system. I do not know in what world this system would be assembled in 20 minutes, though. My plants are not all in a row, evenly spaced, so it took some engineering to get the hoses adjusted. They include a generous amount of tubing and miscellaneous parts. I wish there had been better directions on how to set the timer. It has rained every day since I installed this, so have not really used it yet. I do think it's a great system, and I am excited to put it to good use
customer_reviews.author: mothera8

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great company..
customer_reviews.text: It worked great and was easy to install. I had been watering my planters almost every day, but now I can just enjoy my flowers. I can go on vacation or a weekend getaway without worrying that my plants would be dead when I got back. I bought two of these kits to accommodate my back and side plantings. One timer didn't work, but the customer service was great and sent me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseygirl

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 and a half months
customer_reviews.text: The product has stopped working and tried to set it to manual timer but that does not work as well. I'm really disappointed as when it did work, my plants were flourishing. There was another issue that the drips are not consistent. You will notice water coming out the fastest in the first and then slowing down as you proceed down the line. Sadly DO NOT BUY this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bucx

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate Water Flow
customer_reviews.text: Great service during purchase and delivery. Acceptable instructional videos. However, assembly instructions could be clearer. Water flow was inadequate (faucet was above ground and on an outside wall). I adhered to limitations in instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Earl C

customer_reviews.title: Worked well minus a few nozzles
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and easy to figure out and install. My only complaint is that some of the nozzles seemed to be clogged because when i initially tested the system, water only came out of certain nozzles. I cut the tubing again and replaced the nozzles, and that seemed to work. Overall, i am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jkell

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one season
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted one season and started leaking. It might of been my fault as I left it out all winter. Customer service is a joke. Emailed them for warranty help, said I will be contacted within 24 hours. Nothing.....haven't heard a word from them. Ended up buying a Orbit timer from home depot which seemed to work perfectly for now.
customer_reviews.author: Dakol

customer_reviews.title: Raindrip R560DP Containr
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Be aware you have to push the battery pack in 'hard' and hear a click. Once that was figured out I have two of these, one inside the house and one in the garden. Mine are under cover, so don't know if they would be good exposed to direct sunlight. Happy with the garden, it is much greener now with these
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Very suprised
customer_reviews.text: I thought with was going to be another 'made in China' throwaway. I am very satisfied with this product. I've been using it for several weeks with no issues! Let's how it lasts a few years.
customer_reviews.author: labarriere

customer_reviews.title: Second defective unit in a year
customer_reviews.text: Unit defective and no way to contact customer service. This is my second one in a year that has not worked. And now do I really have to take all the pieces apart again and send it back? Come on Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: L. Goshorn

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: I fed it with 50psi water pressure and the output was just drips. The components are standard stuff you can get at any hardware store and the quality is OK. The problem is the battery powered controller. There was plenty of water and pressure in and zip output. I was on a short time schedule so I set a very long run time and hoped for the best. When I returned 30 days later half the plants were dead. The unit is now in a pile waiting for the next trash run. I usually only write positive reviews, but this is really a bad design, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jess C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: A must for those who love plants!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why we didn't do this sooner! I love flowers, but not the daily hassle of watering them. And if you miss a day, the plants look like you have neglected them for a week. Not to mention going on vacation and setting up a make shift watering system that kinda works. Some plants are fine, while others are not. It takes some time to plan and execute putting the kit together, but you will quickly make up that time and more! No more stressing about watering the flowers! Our plants have never been happier and so am I.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Raindrip, makes watering a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: Glad we bought this watering system and really happy with the results. We have this hooked up for the front porch and plants below. 3 hanging baskets and 6 planters. Having it setup for 2 waterings a day has made our flowers flourish. We used to water these by hand, now we just sit back and watch our plants grow. My only complaint is that the hoses are black and our porch is painted white so does not look the greatest. I might buy white hose and replace them at some point.
customer_reviews.author: V S

customer_reviews.title: Can I just say I love not having to either take down the baskets to ...
customer_reviews.text: Our front porch gets a lot of sun and we were constantly watering all the hanging baskets. We thought we would give this product a try and see if it would really help. Can I just say I love not having to either take down the baskets to water, or hold a hose or container up to water each one. Saves so much time and mess from over flowing and dirt coming with the extra water. Not to mention the plants in all of my baskets look absolutely amazing! It took minutes to put together and through each basket and it is done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade sprinkler heads.
customer_reviews.text: You’ll need one more thing unless you have a series of house plants medium size but need the same amount water. Grabbed a handful of adjustable sprinkler heads and you can tune the system to different size plants with different needs.
customer_reviews.author: John Williams

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo easy to install and works like a charm on our ...
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo easy to install and works like a charm on our hanging pots. They are west facing and get a lot of hot sun but the settings on the timer allow us to water as frequently as the weather demands. I T'd twice. Once to the hose and the timer and a second time at the end of the timer to the drip system and a soaker hose that runs in some of our more thirsty flowers. Works grand.
customer_reviews.author: Toomutch

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This system is great! I planted a garden at my job and considering I am the only pertain there with a green thumb I was on the search for something to water it while I was on vacation for three weeks. I finally stumbled across this online. It was the first affordable truly automatic option I had found. I only wish the instructions were more thorough. I must have put all the right connections together because it works like a charm. After fertilizing, putting down weed barrier, and installing the drip system my only complaint is there isn't very much for me to do other than watch my garden grow. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: JLynn

customer_reviews.title: Yes!! This is amazing. Everything you need
customer_reviews.text: I love this! And I would definitely purchase again. Everything you need is in this box. You will not regret buying this. Plus it's cheaper then purchasing it at a local retail store
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Saved our plants
customer_reviews.text: Every year we seem to forget to regularly water my wife's hanging baskets and potted plants near our front porch. This saved the day. The plants stayed green and lush all summer long, and have much more flowers as well. Just need to figure out how to winterize the lines when I take off the timer this fall and we will be all set.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Emitters don't work
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I had to jostle and adjust water pressure to get timer to work at first. The big failing of this product was that none of the emitters would allow water through, no matter the water pressure, the water pressure build up made the connections burst in some places. I just removed all emitters and turned water pressure down way low so as not to flood all the planters.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L. Lardie

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a miss!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get the emitters to move water. I followed the directions for the installation and used a 25 psi pressure regulator. The timer was solid, although the housing slowly dripped water whenever it was actively watering.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk stop working by September, i change the battery thot its the problem but wont work.Dont buy u just gonna waste your money,this drip system is worthless.Be ware.
customer_reviews.author: rhea

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.  Plants look great!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was pretty straightforward and easy to perform. I am watering about 18 plants with this setup and it is performing great thus far. My only complaint would be that they offer the timer module where it can be mounted remotely using a jumper hose from your source. So it would be nice to have a timer module that you can connect directly to the hose (which it currently does) AND the option for getting a mountable timer module.
customer_reviews.author: Atomtraveler

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. And the water timer has saved my life / my plants life. Last year I was using the hose to water my 35+ plants (tomatoes, peppers, etc). I kept having dreams that a freak storm took my garden out. It was just too much work until I got this baby. No stressful garden dreams this year. This thing is a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: rokonrae

customer_reviews.title: Rain drip
customer_reviews.text: This is the answer to all those people out there that over water their crops.(Like me). My plants are in absolutely perfcet shape now, thank-you
customer_reviews.author: tina pope

customer_reviews.title: ... way of logical mind when it comes to things like this. And I have no patience
customer_reviews.text: I am in no way of logical mind when it comes to things like this. And I have no patience. That said, I got this thing up and running, watering my 5 hanging baskets, within 2 hours (not the 20 minutes shown in the video). Now, If I were to do this again, I think I could get it in less than an hour. I did run out of the hooks for attaching the tube (10 was nowhere near enough) but I used some small nails instead. I love this thing. 2 hours well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Camano Island

customer_reviews.title: Works Better Than a Watering Wand!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to handle watering several planters while we were away for 12 days. Didn't have time to determine an optimum watering schedule beforehand & reviews provided no clues. 90-degree+ days the entire time. Set it for 30 min twice a day. Came back to a jungle! Does a better job and with less water than using a watering wand. Highly recommend. Easy to set up, just time consuming. Agree with the reviewer about mistakes - once the tubing is inserted in a tee, it doesn't come out without causing damage. Just add a connector & additional tubing.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Therapy

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: This worked very nicely for about 2 months. It stopped working. I changed the batteries—nothing. Junk. Dont waste your money. Very dissapoimted. Total let down. I bought this system to water my hanging baskets hile on a two week vacation. Came home to dead plants.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Timer stopped working after 1.5 Months
customer_reviews.text: At first I was in love with this drip system - I found it simple to install and easy to use. It kept my container garden of vegetables and flowers alive and looking better than ever while I was away for 2 weeks. Unfortunately, the timer has stopped working (ie.; it no longer turns on the valve) after 45 days of use. I tried all troubleshooting to no avail. Will try to get replacement from manufacturer, but based on other's comments, I am not confident (will update review based on my effort's success).
customer_reviews.author: DaveNBuster
